CONSTRUCTION OF MAHINDA RAJAPAKSA INTERNATIONAL CRICKET STADIUM, SOORIYAWEWA:
asked the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs: (a) Will he inform this House -
(i) the amount spent to construct the Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium at Sooriyawewa;
(ii) whether foreign donations were received for the construction of the stadium; and
(iii) if so, separately, the value of each foreign donation?
(b) Will he also inform this House-
(i) whether tenders had been called to construct the aforesaid stadium;
(ii) if not, the procedure followed to select the relevant construction company; and
(iii) if the above construction had been carried out by a foreign company, its Sri Lankan agent?
(c) Will he further inform this House -
(i) the amount of Government funds spent for the construction of the stadium;
(ii) the institutions from which the funds were obtained; and
(iii) separately, the income and the expenditure of the stadium from the date it was declared open according to each year?
(d) If not, why? ( ( - ) (The Hon. Harin Fernando - Minister of Tourism and Lands and Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs) .

. ) (The Hon. Weerasumana Weerasinghe on behalf of the Hon.
asked the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs:

(a) Will he inform the House - (i) the number of international cricket matches that were played at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, in each of the years from 2010 to 2022 separately; (ii) the amount earned as income from each of these matches, separately; (iii) the amount of money that was spent for the maintenance of the stadium in each of the years from 2010 to 2022, separately; and (iv) whether the Sri Lanka Cricket does the maintenance activities of the stadium?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Harin Fernando) * .
NATIONAL LOTTERIES BOARD : REVENUE AND DISBURSED
) (The Hon. Weerasumana Weerasinghe on behalf of the Hon.
asked the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policy:
(i) the number of sales agents of the National Lotteries Board;
(ii) the number of lottery tickets of the aforesaid Board sold at district level along with the revenue earned through it in each year during the period from the year 2019 up to now, separately; and

(iii) the amount given out of the aforesaid revenue to the President's Fund, the Mahapola Scholarship Fund, the Treasury and other welfare activities in each year during the period from the year 2019 up to now, separately ? (b) If not, why ?
) (The Hon. Weerasumana Weerasinghe on behalf of the Hon.
asked the Minister of Mass Media:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) separately, the number of existing television and radio channels in Sri Lanka; (ii) whether there are television and radio channels operated without licences among the television and radio channels in Sri Lanka; (iii) if so, the action that has been taken in that regard; and (iv) whether applications have been received to launch new television and radio channels?
(b) If not, why? ) ( - ) (The Hon. Shantha Bandara - State Minister of Mass Media) * .
: MAHARAGAMA BRANCH OF SRI LANKA INSURANCE
) (The Hon. Weerasumana Weerasinghe on behalf of the Hon.
asked the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policy:
(i) whether he is aware that a huge financial misappropriation has taken place in the Maharagama and Hiripitiya branches of the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation in the first quarter of the year 2023;
(iii) whether the dishonesty of the officers has caused a delay of a week or two in the enforcement of the law in this regard ;
(iv) the officers involved in this financial misappropriation;
(v) the action that will be taken against the aforesaid officials;
(vi) the manner in which the misappropriated money will be recovered?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) whether the Heads of the aforesaid branches should bear ultimate responsibility for the said financial misappropriation;
(ii) if so, the action that will be taken against the said Heads ;
(c) If not, why? ( () ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Susil Premajayantha, Attorney-at-Law) * .
( - ) (The Hon. Weerasumana Weerasinghe on behalf of the Hon. Mayantha Dissanayake) - (1)
asked the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries:

(a) Will he inform this House- (i) whether he is aware that abandonment of paddy fields in the wet zone has caused reduction in food production; (ii) the proposals that are being implemented for asvaddumizing abandoned paddy fields; (iii) whether is it accepted that paddy fields have been abandoned as farmers have given up paddy cultivation; (iv) the reasons that underlie for farmers to give up paddy cultivation; and (v) what solutions are given for it?

(b) Will he also inform this House - (i) the number of officers assigned at ministerial, provincial and divisional levels in relation to paddy cultivation, separately; (ii) whether there is a new national policy introduced to develop Agriculture; and (iii) if yes, what that policy is?
- Participatory conservation and productivity improvement of paddy-based eco system in low country Wet-Zone - .
2023/2024 7. ( - ) (The Hon. Weerasumana Weerasinghe on behalf of the Hon. Shanakiyan Rajaputhiran Rasamanickam) - (1)

(a) Is he aware that - (i) the Mahiloor Central Dispensary has been established in the Mahiloor area of the Eruvilpattu Divisional Secretary's Division, Manmune South of Batticaloa district; (ii) the aforesaid dispensary was established, acquiring a land where the people had been settled for a long period of time; and (iii) they have been given a lesser extent of land than the previous land when alternative lands were given to aforesaid people elsewhere for settlement?
(b) If so, will he inform this House whether steps will be taken to provide a remedy for aforesaid matter?

(c) Will he also inform this House- (i) whether he is aware that there is no permanent Doctor, ambulance service, sufficient beds and adequate toilet facilities in aforesaid dispensary which offers services to the people living in the villages , Ontachchimadam, Kurumanveli, Mahiloor and Eruvil; (ii) if so, whether steps are being taken to meet the aforesaid requirements; (iii) of the aforesaid measures?

(ii) of the measures that will be taken to further promote the implementation of renewable energy projects?

( () ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Suren Raghavan) . : . . . . Today, the Hon. (Dr.) Harsha de Silva talked about a social market economy. . ?
Social market economy ? - fiscal procedures - . : . : 80 . Fiscal procedures had been followed so much so that even our Central Bank had

been made an independent institution with accountability to the people, where the Governor is responsible for infla-tion and economic growth. We have done that; Hon. (Dr.) Harsha de Silva, we have done that.

stability of the currency . . check . 299 . 420 we have brought down to be less than Rs. 300. That is cur-rency stability, which is a fundamental part of the so-called social market economy that the present Opposition is trying to embrace.
Then, price stabilization. We have brought price stabili-zation to every essential good; when it comes to electricity, fuel, gas and medicine, there is price stabilization now.

Economic competition is another factor. Yes, we have opened our market. It is only two weeks ago that we final-ized the Free Trade Agreement with Singapore. Of course, I had to questioned the chief negotiator about the Agreement. question : . . .
. . . . : . . ? ? "We are confident about Sri Lankas recovery and are willing to help Sri Lanka in her journey" . . PhD . In case, social market economy . The Island . -
- - ; . . 2023 1.5 . 3.5 . 2.7 . . ? 2022 7.8 2.7 . ? ? ? . . 16 The Times of India article . 8 ADF Re-port . Asian Development Fund - ADF - . Fund 8 3.5 . . IMF . IMF 18 . IMF . 18 .
. ; ; . . ? : . . . 400 12 . 2030 6 . Passport Yes, I am a proud Sri Lankan ; :.

Bloomberg has declared that the Sri Lankan currency is the most promising and performing currency in the Asian region now. How did we do that? It is not because we have been debating and answering questions here, but simply because of the absolute sacrifice this countrys ordinary citizens made. So, we ought to recognize their sacrifice and respect them. Our remittances have in-creased; our productivity has increased; our farmers are engaged in farming as they did earlier; our fishermen are going out to the sea because they have enough diesel and kerosene oil for their boats now and our people are now travelling abroad for employment because we have a proper mechanism of issuing passports and the Middle East is picking up again. So, with all these factors, I do not see that there is any other change or any other redirec-tion this country needs except for the carefully guided, principle-based restructuring as well as an industrial-based productivity market.
Then, yes, we are good at our services. But, the danger is this.

ABSORPTION OF CIVIL DEFENCE FORCE OFFICERS SERVING
AS TEMPORARY TEACHERS IN EASTERN PROVINCE TO

( ) (The Hon. Seyed Ali Zahir Moulana) Hon. Speaker, I take this opportunity to second the Adjournment Motion moved by the Hon. S.M.M. Muszhaaraff regarding the voluntary teachers who have been serving in the North and the East.

During the very difficult time when the entire civil administration and various other services were at a stand-still and normalcy was not prevalent, these people came forward and were teaching voluntarily. The Hon. Muszhaaraff mentioned about the Ampara District. But, not only in the Ampara District, but it happened in the Batticaloa and Trincomalee Districts as well. I must make special mention here that out of those recruits, those who served as temporary teachers in the Northern Province were absorbed into the Northern Province Teachers Ser-vices upon a Cabinet Decision initiated in the year 2019 by the then State Minister of Education, the Hon. (Mrs.) Vijayakala Maheswaran. But, unfortunately, those who were working as volunteer teachers in the Eastern Prov-ince were excluded, they were not absorbed. So, it is very correct to be brought up by our Colleague, the Hon. S.M.M. Muszhaaraff and I take pleasure in seconding the Motion.

I know that the Hon. Minister will look into this mat-ter. I have personally known many of these teachers from the Batticaloa District. Hon. Minister, kindly look into this and make sure they are absorbed into the Teachers Service with their voluntary service also being recog-nized.

( () - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Susil Premajayantha, Attorney-at-Law - Minister of Education and the Leader of the House of Par-liament) 2024.05.13 . "2017.01.18 /16/2626/742/040-1 3-II " . " : . " . 62 69 - - 2017 .
